page.title: 10HEATHLAND ON ARNE PENINSULA
page.content: Most of the area is covered by dry heath and is a callunetum,i.e. Ling Heather is the dominant species. Bell Heather,Gorse and Bracken are other important constituents of the vegetation.This is typical vegetation of the dry Podzol soils of the Poole basin,formed on the underlying Bagshot sands and gravels.This soil is sandy, acid,leached and poor in nutrients,and supports a typical calcifuge vegetation. In the wetter areas Cross-leaved Heath is the typical species of heather, and is found amongst Purple Moor Grass, Bog Myrtle,Sphagnum, Sundew,Clustered Rush and Lichens. Sundew is particularly interesting as it is an insectivorous plant trapping insects in its leaves to provide the nitrates lacking in this acid soil.
